forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 56. North northwest wind 9 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 43 mph.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 69, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. North northeast wind 13 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 39 mph.

weather_report:
As evening descends upon Downtown San Francisco, the air is crisp, marked by the gentle embrace of clarity—most of the fog seems to have retreated, leaving a captivating view. The streets breathe quietly beneath the scattered glow of city lights, and a light breeze dances through the chill, reminding you of the signature wind with gusts that whisper at 25 miles per hour. Tonight’s low is a comfortable 56 degrees, enticing those who crave the serenity of the night to venture outside, perhaps for a leisurely stroll along the waterfront or through the heart of the Mission, where vibrant murals stand in sharp contrast to the night sky.

Looking ahead to Wednesday, expect a sunlit day that stirs vitality in the air. A high near 69 will warm the heart while a steady north northeast wind brings refreshing breezes—ideal for those yearning to bask in the autumn sun. As temperatures begin to dip in the afternoon, layers will become your best friend. A light jacket against that warm glow will serve you well, perfect for an afternoon coffee in a cozy café or a stroll through one of the city’s sprawling parks. With clear skies revealing the distinct outlines of the Golden Gate, embrace these moments; they are a lovely reminder of the blend of urban life and natural beauty that makes this city uniquely enchanting.
